subject: Horizon login page contains DOS attack mechanism
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-09 15:46:13.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/views.py', 'horizon/middleware.py'], 'message': 'Horizon login page contains DOS attack mechanism

the horizon login page (really the middleware) accesses the session
too early in the login process, which will create session records
in the session backend.  This is especially problematic when non-cookie
backends are used.

Change-Id: I9d2c40403fb9b0cfb512f2ff45397cbe0b050c71
Closes-Bug: 1394370
'}]
commit_message:
Horizon login page contains DOS attack mechanism

the horizon login page (really the middleware) accesses the session
too early in the login process, which will create session records
in the session backend.  This is especially problematic when non-cookie
backends are used.

Change-Id: I9d2c40403fb9b0cfb512f2ff45397cbe0b050c71
Closes-Bug: 1394370

subject: Allow injecting arbitrary yum repo configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-12-04 20:09:13.000000000', 'files': ['elements/yum/cleanup.d/99-remove-yum-repo-conf', 'elements/yum/extra-data.d/99-yum-repo-conf', 'elements/yum/README.md'], 'message': 'Allow injecting arbitrary yum repo configuration

Allows specifying the path to a yum repo configuration file to be used
during the image build process. The repo configuration file is removed
at the end of the build. This is useful in that it allows using any
arbitrary repo configuration during an image build.

Change-Id: I7d5c67d74a0bb4722ffc60aacfd9fa7e80fb59d5
'}]
commit_message:
Allow injecting arbitrary yum repo configuration

Allows specifying the path to a yum repo configuration file to be used
during the image build process. The repo configuration file is removed
at the end of the build. This is useful in that it allows using any
arbitrary repo configuration during an image build.

Change-Id: I7d5c67d74a0bb4722ffc60aacfd9fa7e80fb59d5

commit_message:
Horizon login page contains DOS attack mechanism

the horizon login page (really the middleware) accesses the session
too early in the login process, which will create session records
in the session backend.  This is especially problematic when non-cookie
backends are used.

Change-Id: I9d2c40403fb9b0cfb512f2ff45397cbe0b050c71
Closes-Bug: 1394370

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-12-09 14:45:06.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_client.py', 'glanceclient/shell.py', 'glanceclient/v1/client.py', 'glanceclient/v2/client.py', 'tests/v2/test_client.py', 'tests/test_shell.py', 'glanceclient/client.py', 'glanceclient/common/utils.py', 'tests/v1/test_client.py'], 'message': "Don't require version to create Client instance

We currently require a version to always be passed to discover the
client version that should be loaded. However, this information is
commonly present in the URL instead. The current behavior forces
consumers of the library to keep the required version around and/or to
strip it themselves from the URL.

This patch relaxes that requirement by making the version a keyword and
requesting instead an endpoint to be passed. The patch gives priority to
the version in the endpoint and falls back to the keyword if the later is
not present.

Follow-up patches will improve this code making it interact a bit more
with the endpoint's catalog.

Closes-bug: #1395714
Change-Id: I4ada9e724ac4709429e502b5a006604ca0453f61"}]
commit_message:
Don't require version to create Client instance

We currently require a version to always be passed to discover the
client version that should be loaded. However, this information is
commonly present in the URL instead. The current behavior forces
consumers of the library to keep the required version around and/or to
strip it themselves from the URL.

This patch relaxes that requirement by making the version a keyword and
requesting instead an endpoint to be passed. The patch gives priority to
the version in the endpoint and falls back to the keyword if the later is
not present.

Follow-up patches will improve this code making it interact a bit more
with the endpoint's catalog.

Closes-bug: #1395714
Change-Id: I4ada9e724ac4709429e502b5a006604ca0453f61

commit_message:
5.1.1 Known Issue about CentOS/neutron netfilter/Security Groups

/etc/sysctl netfilter parameters are set to 0 rather than 1
on CentOS.  It's too late to apply a fix to 5.1.1 so adding
to the Known Issues list.

Change-Id: I4f4e11e207bb1ce6e66e6bc526a8f62fbafa4563
Partial-Bug: 1400787

query 1 node having the tuple (host, node)

Here, we also need to provide a compatiblity layer in the ComputeNode

commit_message:
Add cn_get_all_by_host and cn_get_by_host_and_node to ComputeNode

Following the addition of the host field, now we can query by this field.
Here, there are additions for querying N nodes having same host and for
query 1 node having the tuple (host, node)

Here, we also need to provide a compatiblity layer in the ComputeNode
object to make sure that if old compute nodes are still running without
host field, we can still search against them.

Partially-Implements blueprint detach-service-from-computenode

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-11-30 15:04:40.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/test_l3_agent_driver_manager.py', 'neutron/agent/l3_agent.py', 'neutron/services/vpn/agent.py', 'neutron/services/firewall/agents/l3reference/firewall_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/firewall/test_firewall_service.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/firewall/agents/l3reference/test_firewall_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/vpn/test_vpn_service.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/test_advanced_service.py', 'neutron/services/advanced_service.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3_agent_driver_manager.py', 'neutron/services/firewall/agents/firewall_service.py', 'neutron/services/vpn/vpn_service.py'], 'message': "Hand out L3 agent driver notifications

The L3 agent will now notify its drivers when a router is created,
updated or deleted.

Driver registration is handled by calling driver.register(driver_manager).
Registering the same type of driver twice is forbidden. Drivers are
singletons.

To-Do:
* The patch, as it is, mimics the current behavior. If a driver
  fails, the other drivers don't get notified, and the entire operation fails.
  Should each driver notification be surrounded in a try/except block,
  so that other drivers may be notified? Should we re-raise at the end of the
  notification process?
* Sending notifications is currently intertwined in the L3 agent code,
  even adding logic such as: Is this router new, or is merely an update?
  Is there a way to decouple this code from the agent, or otherwise make it
  less invasive?
* Should events be sent in dedicated Eventlet threads? I think that if needed,
  this functionality can be added at a later date.

Partially-implements: blueprint restructure-l3-agent
Change-Id: Id8dfc45c127869861a4abdbc60e1222ac17858bd
"}]
commit_message:
Hand out L3 agent driver notifications

The L3 agent will now notify its drivers when a router is created,
updated or deleted.

Driver registration is handled by calling driver.register(driver_manager).
Registering the same type of driver twice is forbidden. Drivers are
singletons.

To-Do:
* The patch, as it is, mimics the current behavior. If a driver
  fails, the other drivers don't get notified, and the entire operation fails.
  Should each driver notification be surrounded in a try/except block,
  so that other drivers may be notified? Should we re-raise at the end of the
  notification process?
* Sending notifications is currently intertwined in the L3 agent code,
  even adding logic such as: Is this router new, or is merely an update?
  Is there a way to decouple this code from the agent, or otherwise make it
  less invasive?
* Should events be sent in dedicated Eventlet threads? I think that if needed,
  this functionality can be added at a later date.

Partially-implements: blueprint restructure-l3-agent
Change-Id: Id8dfc45c127869861a4abdbc60e1222ac17858bd

commit_message:
Libvirt: SMB volume driver

Currently, there are Libvirt volume drivers that support
network-attached file systems such as Gluster or NFS. This patch
adds a new volume driver in order to support attaching volumes
hosted on SMB shares.

Co-Authored-By: Gabriel Samfira <gsamfira@cloudbasesolutions.com>

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1db3d2a6d8ee94932348c63cc03698fdefff0b5c
Implements: blueprint libvirt-smbfs-volume-support

revisions:

This will slightly increase the timeout for the undercloud jobs but the

Change-Id: I532d79e260e44e95d72e2372b1afb801c3bddf4d
'}]
commit_message:
Use a job-template for the tripleo jobs

Now that we are setting the tripleo control variables in tripleo-ci we
can use a template for all of the tripleo jobs as the only difference
between them is the job name.

This will slightly increase the timeout for the undercloud jobs but the
impact of this side effect should be minimal.

Change-Id: I532d79e260e44e95d72e2372b1afb801c3bddf4d

commit_message:
Remove tripleo control variables

And replace them with a single environment variable "TOCI_JOBTYPE",
toci can then be used to set tripleo control variables outside of the
jenkins job configuration.

This commit should be merged after its counterpart in the infra/config
repository I5ed1a7bb473d9f7183b3a036702a1c71bfc5870d

Change-Id: I58462d3ce3e63ea190c95e2a210c087c978c7d16

the default maxconn is only 150, which maybe good for api services
but not enough for the rabbitmq session in a cluster as small as 15
nodes. so bump up the number to 1500 for rabbitmq to allow for 100

Change-Id: Ieb707b31022a6fc9ade32ed2a332b67bf4dc0311

commit_message:
bump up the number of sesson limit for rabbitmq

the default maxconn is only 150, which maybe good for api services
but not enough for the rabbitmq session in a cluster as small as 15
nodes. so bump up the number to 1500 for rabbitmq to allow for 100
nodes. this number should be calculated based on the scale numbers
in the long run.
Closes-bug: #1386406

Change-Id: Ieb707b31022a6fc9ade32ed2a332b67bf4dc0311
